g.text: ), and temperature reduction is important in this time of the
year. In monthly average, the most signiﬁcant temperature reduction occurred in
C for SH1 compared to full
sun system), and the blossoming period occured in the end of September and
October. In this context, it is important to study the shade scheme before imple-
menting it, preferably in an interdisciplinary scope. To implement eﬃcient man-
agement, it is essential to study current and future climate projections, coﬀee
ﬂowering time, orientation (scheme) of cultivation in the ﬁeld, mathematical
modelling, and local (producers) acceptance to combine the balance between adap-
The traditional south region of Minas Gerais may lose suitable areas for coﬀee
), especially due to temperature increase and modiﬁed rainfall
pattern. Temperature is the most important and decisive meteorological variable to
quality, and growth. Adaptation is therefore required and, since shade management
reduces temperature, the practice may be considered a signiﬁcant option to adapt
coﬀee to climate change. However, as suggested in this study, the low level of
shades may not reduce temperature in the blossoming period, but may reduce it
along the year. Therefore, it is essential to plan shade schemes to reduce thermal
Nevertheless, one facet of adaptation actions to climate change is the diversiﬁcation
). It may be achieved with moderate to high level of shade in
. Although high levels of shade in coﬀee cultivation is not possible without
sibilities may ariseby joining REDD program (Reducing Emissions from Deforesta-
tion and Forest Degration). in developing countries, with carbon credits (
), sustainable management, signiﬁcant reductions in N-fertilizer inputs
highlights that sustainable coﬀee production reduces coﬀee car-
bon footprint, resulting in a ﬁnancial gain in coﬀee commercialization.
Analyzing gains and losses of high level of coﬀee shading in present time, means
that this management seems to be more appropriate and eﬃcient to the studied re-
gion, because it collaborates to both activities: mitigation and adaptation. Finally,
the system may be conveniently used as proposed by
to reforest degraded lands, improve ecosystem services, sus-
tainability, carbon sequestration and stock, and to reduce the environment
